name: Houston Rockets
history: The franchise was founded in 1967 as the San Diego Rockets before relocating to Houston in 1971 to align with the city's connection to NASA. They achieved back-to-back NBA championships in 1994 and 1995 behind the dominance of Hakeem 'The Dream' Olajuwon. The Rockets have a long tradition of elite center play and advanced analytics, often pushing the boundaries of traditional basketball strategy. Today, the 'Clutch City' spirit lives on as the team builds around a new generation of versatile, high-scoring talent.
fun_facts: Hakeem Olajuwon is the only player in NBA history to record more than 200 blocks and 200 steals in the same season.
In 2004, Tracy McGrady scored 13 points in the final 33 seconds of a game to beat the San Antonio Spurs.
Yao Ming, selected #1 overall in 2002, was the first international player to be drafted first without playing US college basketball.
The team was originally named the 'Rockets' because they were founded in San Diego, where Atlas rockets were manufactured.
They once missed 27 consecutive three-pointers in a Game 7 of the Western Conference Finals in 2018.
